postings.heading: Beautiful LES Studio in Great Building $450

postings.body:
Howdy y`alls! Housemate is moving out to live with his lovely girlfriend and I`m looking for some nice folks to rent his room. Couples preferred so as to cut down on the rent. This place is the business, no joke. Let me tell you a tale:
Location
Adam`s Point. 10-15 minute walk to the 19th St. BART station. Burrito shop down the street. 10-15 minute walk to the Grand Lake Theatre area. Wicked farmer`s market on Saturdays. Equidistant to Whole Foods and Trader Joe`s. And of course Lake Merritt, the scenic gem of central Oakland.
Details and Amenities
Apartment highrise typical of the area, but a little bit taller than the rest of `em. 2 bedrooms. Separate bathrooms, how nice! Strange red heat lamps in each one (and normal lights, of course). Ridiculous amount of storage space. Unobstructed views of Lake Merritt (the whole damn thing!) from the living room. Grand Lake Theater and the Oakland Hills from the kitchen. Berkeley and Piedmont from the bedrooms. Balconies? We got `em! Gets some sweet sweet sunshine all day long. Warm in the winter, cool in the summer. Funky 60-ish interior. Washer and Dryers in the building. Parking space for 1 car (my housemate and I would trade off, worked pretty well). Mailboxes. Carpet on the walls of the elevators. A rad old lady who manages the building. What more could you ask for? Pets, you say? Sorry friend, how I wish it were so. (no pets. sorry.)
Mostly Furnished
Kitchenware. Couch. Chair(s). Bookshelves. A desk. Table(s). A wall clock. Toaster. Microwave.You`ll need your own bed. Pictures on the wall. No TVs allowed!
The Deal
Rent is $1300. Deposit is $750. Month to month. Utilities get split evenly (typical bills have been about $20 a month, total). Room for rent is the bigger of the two, space for a queen-sized no problem. Private attached bathroom. Internet is up and running, can`t remember how much off the top of my head but nothing outrageous.
Who is this guy?
29 year old typical white male varietal. Works in the City. Eats anything. Runs. Bikes. Climbs. Can grow a mean beard. Can wash a mean dish. Loves a good thrashing out in wilderness. Sleeps like a rock and/or the dead.
Who are you guys?
I really don`t care so long as your feets are on the ground, heads in the clouds, and hearts in the right place. Bonus points for bikes as primary means of transport. More bonus points if you have laugh wrinkles `round the eyes. No car? Ding ding we have a winner! (but it`s OK if you do. I`ve got one too.)
Availability
Looking for a move-in at the end of August, but could do earlier potentially.
Send me a text. Or an email. Tell me `bout your fine selves. Come and visit. Godspeed and goodluck!

postings.heading: NEWLY RENOVATED 3BR/1BATH HUGE SPACEWONT LAST

postings.body:
There is an apt in the Ballston area that will have a vacant room for occupancy starting on or around September 1st, 2014 - or a little bit earlier.
The apartment complex is right by the Ballston metro (literally a half a minute walk from the metro). It`s a nice, well-appointed apartment with lots of amenities at your disposal - spacious, recently renovated club room with billiards/pool table, TV sets and gaming systems, lovely kitchen space to host parties, etc; amazing rooftop swimming pool and open terrace space for relaxation, sunbathing, dinner with friends, etc.; library/conference room facility; a spacious, well-appointed gym open for use 20 hours in a day; free/complementary wi-fi in the common areas (such as the club room, conference room facilities, and the lobby area, concierge service, etc..).
More pictures on the apartment complex website can be gleaned from here:
http://www.meridianballston.com/arlington-arlington/meridian-at-ballston-commons-meridianballstoncommons/photos/
The apartment is furnished with most of what you need - living space and kitchen areas are fully furnished, bathroom kept very tidy. The room that will be vacant has comes with a huge wall to wall closet space, a queen size bed with a box spring, tables and night stand.
Cable and internet is available inside the apartment.
The Ballston Commons area is also a very nice area. It has a number of attractions within a walking distance. It has medium size mall right across the street from the apartment for most every day needs as well as food court; a variety of restaurants; a small movie theatre; shopping centers etc.. The building also has a nice park behind it which is a nice place to hang out and relax. Overall, a very convenient living experience. You have everything you need within an easy walking distance within a couple of blocks of the apartment in Ballston area or a couple of metro stops in clarendon and court house areas.
There is a gorcery store (harris Teeter) within a walking distance. But also Whole foods and Trader Joe`s are in Clarendon two metro stops away. For value shopping Costco is a ten minute drive from the apartment- or also accessible on the metro.
Please get in touch with a phone number as well as an email address where you can be reached if interested to discuss more; would like to set up an appointment for a visit (if you happen to be in town); or would like further clarifications.
Pictures available upon request.
Ideal for someone who will be in town for a few months of internship or schooling - or for someone staying for a few months for work or study- as it all comes in one self-contained package.
Feel free to get in touch if interested.
---------------------------------
Brief Pointers -
APARTMENT FEATURES INCLUDE:
•This apartment complex is immaculate, well maintained and on the same block as the Ballston Metro stop which services the Orange line. Well furnished unit so you can move in with ease.
• Contemporary modern Styling
• Wireless Internet and cable access
• Berber carpeting in Living Areas & Ceramic Tile in Bath & Kitchen
• Full-size Washer & Dryer in residence
• Completely furnished
• Spacious Walk-in Closet
• Underground Parking garage
BUILDING FEATURES INCLUDE:
• Concierge service (with package acceptance and signing)
• Integrated Building Security System with electronic key-fob
• Roof-top Pool and Sun Deck
• Spacious gym with Cardio Equipment, Weights, TVs
• Business Center and Library with complementary WiFi access
• Guest suites to host guests
• Party and Conference Room
• Secure Bike Storage Locations Equipped
• Well Appointed Lobby and Meeting Spaces
• Dry Cleaners on 1st Floor of apartment providing resident discounts
•Apartment Sponsored Parties
BALLSTON, ARLINGTON AREA FEATURES INCLUDE:
• Spectacular Hip & Happening Ballston Location
• Convenient access to out-door recreation (biking and jogging trails)
• 2-Minute Walking distance to Ballston Metro Station
• Walking distance to DARPA and NSF (basically across from the Apartment)
• 1 block away from State Department Foreign Service Institute
• A few blocks to I-66 East and West
• 10 Minutes to Reagan National Airport;
• 20 Minutes to Dulles Airport
• 20 Minutes to Union Station/Amtrak
• 40 Minutes to Baltimore Airport
• 5 Minutes from GW Parkway
• 1 Block from Route 50
• A block from well-reputed area restaurants and bars: PF Chang`s, Westin Hotel`s Pinzi Mini, Big Buns Burgers & Fries, Grand Cru Wine Bar and Restaurant, Sweet Greens, Rustico, Vapioano, Chipotle, Which Wich, and Starbucks Coffee.
• Walking distance to Ballston Common Shopping Mall, Golds gym ( two blocks from the apartment), Sport & Health (across from the apt. complex), Yoga/Pilates Studios, 6 Screen AMC Movie Theater, Harris Teeter, Marvelous Market, Safeway, 30+ Dining Places, Ice Skating, Victoria Secret, CVS, and Parks.
• Within 1 block around the apartment: Rio Grande, The Willow, Ted`s Montana Grill, Vapiano, Front Page, Pot Belly`s, Cosi, Chipotle, Rock Bottom Brewery, Matusake Sushi, Aladdin`s and many more
• Westin Arlington Gateway Hotel is within a block for hosting out-of-town visitors. Other hotels within one or two blocks include: Holiday Inn, Comfort Inn, and Hilton Hotel.

postings.body:
Hi, thanks for reading! We have 1 unfurnished room available in a 4 bedroom, 3 bath house in the Sunnyside neighborhood. It`s a 3 month sublet with the *slight possibility of it turning into something more permanent. I`ll tell you more about that once we meet. Utilities are an additional $150/month. Available August 1st.
About the house: It`s truly an amazing spot. Very spacious with a panoramic view to the south. Living room, dining room, family room, full (large) kitchen, laundry room and... it even has a backyard. Virtually no crime in this neighborhood. It`s a 15 minute walk to Bart... but why walk when you have two bus lines that will take you there. There`s a Safeway 3 blocks away and a Whole Foods 1.1 miles away. Ample street parking - no neighborhood decal required.
About the living situation: You`ll be living with three male roommates, one male kitten and one female kitten -- two of the human housemates are in their late 30`s... and I just celebrated my 41st. We`re all busy bodies and try to maintain a good work/life balance. We believe in keeping the house tidy and peaceful. We have occasional dinner parties, BBQ`s and such but we generally partake in social events outside of the house. No late night parties at the house. You`ll be sharing your bathroom with one other housemate.
We`re open to both male and female candidates.
No need to send a lengthy essay, but in your response please tell me what you do for money, your hobbies (if you have any) and what you value in your domestic/living affairs.
